summary: This document is an email chain from January 15, 2021, concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, urgently notifying prosecutors about the Metropolitan Detention Center's (MDC) non-compliance with a court order granting Maxwell weekend and holiday access to her laptop for discovery review. The chain includes Sternheim's communications with an Assistant U.S. Attorney and her forwarded messages to MDC staff, highlighting a confrontation between Maxwell and an officer.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who is corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office and MDC staff to enforce a court order granting her client laptop access.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the email correspondence regarding the laptop access order.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the email correspondence regarding the laptop access order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Judge who issued the court order granting Ghislaine Maxwell access to her laptop on weekends and holidays.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant whose attorney is fighting for her court-ordered access to a laptop for discovery review.

persons.name: Officer Regan
persons.context: MDC staff member who informed Ghislaine Maxwell she would not receive her laptop on Saturday, explicitly disregarding the court order.

persons.name: Warden Tellez
persons.context: Warden of the Metropolitan Detention Center whom the defense attorney suggests should be directed to appear in court to answer for staff misconduct.

persons.name: Nicole
persons.context: MDC executive assistant (BRO/Exec Assistant) to whom the initial order compliance request was forwarded.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as legal counsel for Maxwell, advocating for her court-ordered privileges.
Both are listed as defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on case correspondence.
Both are listed as defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on case correspondence.
Officer Regan directly informed Maxwell of the MDC's refusal to comply with the court order for laptop access.
Sternheim is notifying Judge Nathan of the MDC's violation of her court order and threatening to bring the matter before her.

events.title: Court Order for Laptop Access
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan grants an unopposed request, ordering the Bureau of Prisons to give Ghislaine Maxwell access to her laptop on weekends and holidays for discovery review.

events.title: MDC Non-Compliance with Court Order
events.description: Officer Regan, team leader of Maxwell's security detail, informs her she will not have access to the laptop on the upcoming Saturday, explicitly stating "I don't care" about the court order.

events.title: Defense Attorney's Urgent Correspondence
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim sends a series of urgent emails to the U.S. Attorney's office and MDC staff, notifying them of the violation and seeking immediate compliance, threatening to inform the judge.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim (West 19th Street office, closed due to Covid-19)
keyFacts: On January 15, 2021, Judge Alison Nathan ordered the Bureau of Prisons to give Ghislaine Maxwell access to her laptop on weekends and holidays for discovery review.
Hours after the order was issued, an MDC officer told Maxwell she would not receive the laptop, stating "I don't care" when informed of the court order.
Defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim characterized the MDC's actions as a "blatant disregard" of the court order and threatened to notify Judge Nathan, potentially leading to contempt proceedings.
The email chain reveals tensions between Maxwell's defense team and prison authorities regarding her treatment and access to legal materials while incarcerated.
